instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: macbook air 820-00165 ho backlight
threads.message: hi i am new here thanks for any help you can give i have a macbook air 820-00165 ho backlight when i add power my pphv_sosw_lcdbklt reads 8.5v then drops when the boost circuit turns on it only goes up to 20v then drops to 8.5 i change the led driver but nothing how can i know the driver is working right

threads.title: macbook air 820-00165 ho backlight
threads.message: I fix it it was a bad led driver

threads.title: macbook air 820-00165 ho backlight
threads.message:
Normal voltage is 25V aprox.
If you get 20V, backlight circuit works somehow, but something blocks it.
You should first try known good LCD assembly.
Use search function on the forum, you will find many-many threads about this board.
I bet you have bad solders on U7701 now, if don't get 20V again at least.
Don't forget to check XW7720 bridge; pictures available on the forum.
Do first few PRAM resets...
